question: As per the agreement recently signed to end the 23-year old Bru-Reang refugee crisis, the Bru tribals can permanently settle in which state?
explanation:
The Government of India, Governments of Tripura and Mizoram and Bru-Reang representatives signed the historic agreement in New Delhi recently, which will end the 23-year old Bru-Reang refugee crisis. 
Under the new agreement, around 34,000 Bru refugees, who were displaced from Mizoram will be permanently settled in Tripura and would be given aid from the Centre to assist their rehabilitation and development, through a fund of Rs 600 crores. Each displaced family will also be given residential plots by the Tripura Government.
